message_1: A group of 8 people are going on a hike and need to divide themselves into 2 teams of equal size. In how many different ways can they be divided?
message_2:
To divide the group of 8 people into 2 teams of equal size (4 people each), we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8) and k is the number of people in each team (4).

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!(8-4)!)

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!4!)

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((4 × 3 × 2 × 1) × (4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5) / (4 × 3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 4) = 1680 / 24

C(8, 4) = 70

So there are 70 different ways to divide the group of 8 people into 2 teams of equal size.
